contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox District DE | name=Nienburg | state=Lower Saxony | capital=[[Nienburg, Lower Saxony|Nienburg]] | area=1399 | Kreisschlüssel = 03256 | population=126,300 | population_as_of=2001 | density=90 | carsign=NI | url=[http://www.landkreis-nienburgweser.de landkreis-nienburgweser.de] | map=Lower Saxony_NI.svg }} '''Nienburg''' is a [[districts of Germany|district]] (''Landkreis'') in [[Lower Saxony]], [[Germany]]. It is bounded by (from the west and clockwise) the districts of [[Diepholz (district)|Diepholz]], [[Verden (district)|Verden]], [[Heidekreis]], [[Hanover (district)|Hanover]] and [[Schaumburg]], and by the state of [[North Rhine-Westphalia]] (district of [[Minden-Lübbecke]]). ==History== From the early Middle Ages to the end of the 16th century this region was the heart of the [[County of Hoya]]. The ruling family became extinct in 1582, and the central and southern parts of the county were annexed by the [[Principality of Lüneburg|Lüneburg branch]] of the duchy of [[Brunswick-Lüneburg]]. In 1705 the area of Nienburg and Hoya became subordinate to [[Electorate of Hanover|Hanover]]. In 1866 the Kingdom of Hanover was annexed by [[Prussia]]. The Prussian government established the districts of Nienburg and Stolzenau, which were merged in 1932. ==Geography== The district is roughly located between [[Bremen (city)|Bremen]] and [[Hanover]]. The [[Weser]] River enters the district in the south, coming from [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], and runs north towards Bremen. ==Coat of arms== {| |- valign=top ||[[Image:Wappen Landkreis Nienburg Weser.svg|100px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms displays: * two horses on piles, a typical decoration of farms in the region * a bear's paw, symbolising the [[County of Hoya]] * a horn from the arms of the [[County of Wölpe]] |} ==Towns and municipalities== {| ! align=left width=25%|Towns ! colspan=3 align=center width=75%|[[Amt (political division)|Samtgemeinden]] |- valign=top || #[[Nienburg, Lower Saxony|Nienburg]] #[[Rehburg-Loccum]] <br> '''Free municipalities'''<br> #[[Steyerberg]] || *'''1.
